Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.matrix

Class SingularValueDecomposition

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.matrix.SingularValueDecomposition
All Implemented Interfaces:
MatrixSolver
public class SingularValueDecomposition extends Object implements MatrixSolver
Singular Value Decomposition.

For an m-by-n matrix A with m >= n, the singular value decomposition is an m-by-n orthogonal matrix U, an n-by-n diagonal matrix S, and an n-by-n orthogonal matrix V so that A = U*S*V'. A inverse is given by Ainv = V*1/S*U' a = V*1/S*U'*b; y = U'*b; z = 1/S*y; a =V*z Solving a system of equations requires that the singularity threshold (st) be set to some small number such that if S(i) < st one sets 1/S(i) = 0. This will still provide a valid solution for the system in a least squares sense.

The singular values, sigma[k] = S[k][k], are ordered so that sigma[0] >= sigma[1] >= ... >= sigma[n-1].

The singular value decomposition always exists, so the constructor will never fail. The matrix condition number and the effective numerical rank can be computed from this decomposition.

    • SingularValueDecomposition

      public SingularValueDecomposition(double[][] A)
      Constructor to find SVD Decomposition
      Parameters:
      A - Rectangular matrix to be decomposed

    • SingularValueDecomposition

      public SingularValueDecomposition(double[][] A, boolean trnsp)
      Decomposes using SVD. If trnsp is true the matrix A is assumed to be the transpose of the matrix for which the decomposition is desired. If this is the case the output matrices U and V are also transposed from those produced if trnsp is false. Note that A is overwritten on output.
      Parameters:
      A - The matrix to be decomposed with SVD.
      trnsp - True if A is the transpose of the matrix to be decomposed.

  • Method Details

    • solveTranspose

      public void solveTranspose()
      Decomposes using the transpose of the input matrix which allows direct access instead of pointer resolved access to the matrix. This method can be much much faster than the standard method if the matrix order is larger than about 20 or 30.

    • decompose

      public void decompose(double[][] A, boolean trnsp)
      Decomposes using SVD. If trnsp is true the matrix A is assumed to be the transpose of the matrix for which the decomposition is desired. If this is the case the output matrices U and V are also transposed from those produced if trnsp is false. Note that A is overwritten on output.
      Parameters:
      A - The matrix to be decomposed with SVD.
      trnsp - True if A is the transpose of the matrix to be decomposed.

    • solve

      public void solve(double[][] a, double[][] b)
      Solve A*a = b
      Specified by:
      solve in interface MatrixSolver
      Parameters:
      a - The solution matrix with as many or more rows than A and at least 1 column that will contain the solution on exit. Note that a will be resized to the size of b on exit but only the first n rows contain the solution.
      b - The RHS Matrix with as many or more rows than A and at least 1 column.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Matrix row dimensions must equal or exceed m.

    • solve

      public void solve(double[][] a)
      Solve A*a = b
      Specified by:
      solve in interface MatrixSolver
      Parameters:
      a - The solution matrix with as many or more rows than A and at least 1 column that will contain the RHS on entry and the solution on exit. Note the solution only overwrites the first n rows of a if m > n.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Matrix row dimensions must equal or exceed m.
